results.title: Black sun
results.creator_credit: Amanda Jane, Hugh Burton and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: The story begins and ends with a funeral. A group of female friends unite for a night of drugs, music and memories under the full moon. One of the girls has been away to the city, and discovers that things don’t stay the same, that friendships change, and can be challenged and proven very quickly. Cast includes Raelee Hill and Brigid Kelly.

results.title: Black scour worm
results.creator_credit: Tom Price and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: This film, deals with the prevention and control of the black scour worm, a parasitic worm which occurs in sheep, cattle, goats and rabbits.The infection is usually picked up in the autumn when feed is short, and symptoms occur in winter: a wet autumn and a dry winter is particularly dangerous. The film stresses that whilst it is almost impossible to eradicate the infection, it is possible to control it to such an extent that economic loss is prevented. The importance of drenching early, when the sheep are fat, is stressed; breeding ewes should be drenched before lambing, especially before autumn lambing, so that the lambs do not become heavily infected; lambs should be drenched at weaning; drenching should be done fairly regularly every four to five weeks from autumn until spring, the wetter the season the more frequent should the treatment be. The film ends by stressing that pastoralists should try to check the growth of the black scour worms long before the sheep show any symptoms of the disease. Narrated by Bob Pollard.

results.title: Black on white
results.creator_credit: John Read, Arts Council of Great Britain and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: A selection of 200 illustrations are used in this survey of cartoon and caricature in Britain over the past 250 years. In dealing with the present century the film shows work by artists such as Bateman, Port, Fougasse, Ronald Searle, Osbert Lancaster, Gibs, Vicky and David Low. Low is shown at work on a cartoon of Clement Attlee and Sir Winston Churchill. Other artists whose work is featured include James Gillroy, Thomas Rowlandson, George Cruikshank, Charles Keene, George du Maurier, John Tenneil, Phil May and Max Beerbohm.

results.title: Black music in America: the 70's
results.creator_credit: BMA and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: An overview of the world of black music in the 1970’s. Presents a musical journey from Motown to disco of Donna Summer. Includes clips of over seventy-five groups showing the growth and influence of black music in this decade. Narrators are Isaac Hayes and Dionne Warwick. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Black man down
results.creator_credit: Bill McCrow, Bruce Redman and Sam Watson
results.brief_description: ‘Black man down’ is a perilous journey into the Aboriginal psyche. It is a journey to the roots of time that expands and pulses with dark, mysterious energies. A young warrior, alone in a prison cell, is plagued and confronted by the ghosts of his past and spirits of the land. Death calls to him with a silken tongue, the sprits urge him to live….

results.title: Black Island
results.creator_credit: Ben Bolt, Carole K. Smith and Children's Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A children’s adventure film about two young boys, Michael and Joe, who find themselves stranded on a remote island with a couple of escaped convicts. Cast includes Martin Murphy, Mikael Salomon, Michael Elphick, Frank Leigh, Allan Surtees, Norman Tipton.

results.title: Black hearted Barney Blackfoot
results.creator_credit: Yvonne MacKay, Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: The story of Billy and Lucy’s mean stepfather who is helped in his evil exploits by his friend the moving wardrobe. A humorous moral tale using sound effects with no commentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yvonne MacKay, Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions

results.title: Black Fire (Blackfire)
results.brief_description: Blackfire is one of the first film ever directed by an Aboriginal person. It is a collection of connected ideas and a take on both the state of Anthropology and Aboriginal Affairs in 1972.

constellations_other.name: Jedda: Uneven ground, the road to on-screen diversity
constellations_other.description: Jedda was the first fully funded Australian feature to be shot on colour film. It was also the first Australian film with Aboriginal actors in lead roles, however, it reflects a deeply problematic time in Australian history.

constellations_other.name: Black Power through film and TV
constellations_other.description: The Black Power movement of the late 1960s and early 70s was “the most exciting and dynamic era in modern Indigenous history” according to Aboriginal activist Professor Gary Foley, who gained widespread attention for protests during the time and later leveraged film and TV to fight for Indigenous rights.

results.description:
Blackfire is one of the first film ever directed by an Aboriginal person. It is a collection of connected ideas and a take on both the state of Anthropology and Aboriginal Affairs in 1972.

Source: Black Fire (Blackfire) (Film) - Creative Spirits, retrieved from https://www.creativespirits.info/resources/movies/black-fire-blackfire
